verses.translation: And this is the past favour wherewith thou reproachest me: that thou hast enslaved the Children of Israel.

verses.content: قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَا رَبُّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: Pharaoh said: And what is the Lord of the Worlds?

verses.content: قَالَ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
verses.translation: (Moses) said: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, if ye had but sure belief.

verses.content: قَالَ لِمَنْ حَوْلَهُ أَلَا تَسْتَمِعُونَ
verses.translation: (Pharaoh) said unto those around him: Hear ye not?

verses.content: قَالَ رَبُّكُمْ وَرَبُّ آبَائِكُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation: He said: Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers.

verses.content: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ الَّذِي أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ
verses.translation: (Pharaoh) said: Lo! your messenger who hath been sent unto you is indeed a madman!

verses.content: قَالَ رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.translation: He said: Lord of the East and the West and all that is between them, if ye did but understand.

verses.content: قَالَ لَئِنِ اتَّخَذْتَ إِلَـٰهًا غَيْرِي لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ الْمَسْجُونِينَ
verses.translation: (Pharaoh) said: If thou choosest a god other than me, I assuredly shall place thee among the prisoners.

verses.content: قَالَ أَوَلَوْ جِئْتُكَ بِشَيْءٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.translation: He said: Even though I show thee something plain?

verses.content: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
verses.translation: (Pharaoh) said: Produce it then, if thou art of the truthful!

verses.content: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.translation: Then he flung down his staff and it became a serpent manifest,

verses.content: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيْضَاءُ لِلنَّاظِرِينَ
verses.translation: And he drew forth his hand and lo! it was white to the beholders.

verses.content: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَسَاحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.translation: (Pharaoh) said unto the chiefs about him: Lo! this is verily a knowing wizard,

verses.content: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
verses.translation: Who would drive you out of your land by his magic. Now what counsel ye?

verses.content: قَالُوا أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَابْعَثْ فِي الْمَدَائِنِ حَاشِرِينَ
verses.translation: They said: Put him off, (him) and his brother, and send into the cities summoners

verses.content: يَأْتُوكَ بِكُلِّ سَحَّارٍ عَلِيمٍ
verses.translation: Who shall bring unto thee every knowing wizard.

verses.content: فَجُمِعَ السَّحَرَةُ لِمِيقَاتِ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
verses.translation: So the wizards were gathered together at a set time on a day appointed.

verses.content: وَقِيلَ لِلنَّاسِ هَلْ أَنتُم مُّجْتَمِعُونَ
verses.translation: And it was said unto the people: Are ye (also) gathering?

verses.content: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ السَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُوا هُمُ الْغَالِبِينَ
verses.translation: (They said): Aye, so that we may follow the wizards if they are the winners.

verses.content: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ السَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ الْغَالِبِينَ
verses.translation: And when the wizards came they said unto Pharaoh: Will there surely be a reward for us if we are the winners?

verses.content: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّمِنَ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ
verses.translation: He said: Aye, and ye will then surely be of those brought near (to me).

verses.content: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰ أَلْقُوا مَا أَنتُم مُّلْقُونَ
verses.translation: Moses said unto them: Throw what ye are going to throw!

verses.content: فَأَلْقَوْا حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الْغَالِبُونَ
verses.translation: Then they threw down their cords and their staves and said: By Pharaoh's might, lo! we verily are the winners.

verses.content: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
verses.translation: Then Moses threw his staff and lo! it swallowed that which they did falsely show.

verses.content: فَأُلْقِيَ السَّحَرَةُ سَاجِدِينَ
verses.translation: And the wizards were flung prostrate,

verses.content: قَالُوا آمَنَّا بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: Crying: We believe in the Lord of the Worlds,

verses.content: رَبِّ مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ
verses.translation: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.

verses.content: قَالَ آمَنتُمْ لَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ آذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ الَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَافٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.translation: (Pharaoh) said: Ye put your faith in him before I give you leave. Lo! he doubtless is your chief who taught you magic! But verily ye shall come to know. Verily I will cut off your hands and your feet alternately, and verily I will crucify you every one.

verses.content: قَالُوا لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
verses.translation: They said: It is no hurt, for lo! unto our Lord we shall return.

verses.content: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَايَانَا أَن كُنَّا أَوَّلَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Lo! we ardently hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we are the first of the believers.

verses.content: وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ
verses.translation: And We inspired Moses, saying: Take away My slaves by night, for ye will be pursued.

verses.content: فَأَرْسَلَ فِرْعَوْنُ فِي الْمَدَائِنِ حَاشِرِينَ
verses.translation: Then Pharaoh sent into the cities summoners,

verses.content: إِنَّ هَـٰؤُلَاءِ لَشِرْذِمَةٌ قَلِيلُونَ
verses.translation: (Who said): Lo! these indeed are but a little troop,

verses.content: وَإِنَّهُمْ لَنَا لَغَائِظُونَ
verses.translation: And lo! they are offenders against us.

verses.content: وَإِنَّا لَجَمِيعٌ حَاذِرُونَ
verses.translation: And lo! we are a ready host.

verses.content: فَأَخْرَجْنَاهُم مِّن جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
verses.translation: Thus did We take them away from gardens and watersprings,

verses.content: وَكُنُوزٍ وَمَقَامٍ كَرِيمٍ
verses.translation: And treasures and a fair estate.

verses.content: كَذَٰلِكَ وَأَوْرَثْنَاهَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
verses.translation: Thus (were those things taken from them) and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit them.

verses.content: فَأَتْبَعُوهُم مُّشْرِقِينَ
verses.translation: And they overtook them at sunrise.

verses.content: فَلَمَّا تَرَاءَى الْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَابُ مُوسَىٰ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ
verses.translation: And when the two hosts saw each other, those with Moses said: Lo! we are indeed caught.

verses.content: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهْدِينِ
verses.translation: He said: Nay, verily! for lo! my Lord is with me. He will guide me.

verses.content: فَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ اضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ الْبَحْرَ ۖ فَانفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍ كَالطَّوْدِ الْعَظِيمِ
verses.translation: Then We inspired Moses, saying: Smite the sea with thy staff. And it parted, and each part was as a mountain vast.

verses.content: وَأَزْلَفْنَا ثَمَّ الْآخَرِينَ
verses.translation: Then brought We near the others to that place.

verses.content: وَأَنجَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَمَن مَّعَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.translation: And We saved Moses and those with him, every one;

verses.content: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا الْآخَرِينَ
verses.translation: And We drowned the others.

verses.content: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

verses.content: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.translation: And lo, thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

verses.content: وَاتْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ نَبَأَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
verses.translation: Recite unto them the story of Abraham:

verses.content: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.translation: When he said unto his father and his folk: What worship ye?

verses.content: قَالُوا نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَاكِفِينَ
verses.translation: They said: We worship idols, and are ever devoted unto them.

verses.content: قَالَ هَلْ يَسْمَعُونَكُمْ إِذْ تَدْعُونَ
verses.translation: He said: Do they hear you when ye cry?

verses.content: أَوْ يَنفَعُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَضُرُّونَ
verses.translation: Or do they benefit or harm you?

verses.content: قَالُوا بَلْ وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.translation: They said: Nay, but we found our fathers acting on this wise.

verses.content: قَالَ أَفَرَأَيْتُم مَّا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.translation: He said: See now that which ye worship,

verses.content: أَنتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُمُ الْأَقْدَمُونَ
verses.translation: Ye and your forefathers!

verses.content: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّ لِّي إِلَّا رَبَّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: Lo! they are (all) an enemy unto me, save the Lord of the Worlds,

verses.content: الَّذِي خَلَقَنِي فَهُوَ يَهْدِينِ
verses.translation: Who created me, and He doth guide me,

verses.content: وَالَّذِي هُوَ يُطْعِمُنِي وَيَسْقِينِ
verses.translation: And Who feedeth me and watereth me.

verses.content: وَإِذَا مَرِضْتُ فَهُوَ يَشْفِينِ
verses.translation: And when I sicken, then He healeth me,

verses.content: وَالَّذِي يُمِيتُنِي ثُمَّ يُحْيِينِ
verses.translation: And Who causeth me to die, then giveth me life (again),

verses.content: وَالَّذِي أَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لِي خَطِيئَتِي يَوْمَ الدِّينِ
verses.translation: And Who, I ardently hope, will forgive me my sin on the Day of Judgment.

verses.content: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي حُكْمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِي بِالصَّالِحِينَ
verses.translation: My Lord! Vouchsafe me wisdom and unite me to the righteous.

verses.content: وَاجْعَل لِّي لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِي الْآخِرِينَ
verses.translation: And give unto me a good report in later generations.

verses.content: وَاجْعَلْنِي مِن وَرَثَةِ جَنَّةِ النَّعِيمِ
verses.translation: And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Delight,

verses.content: وَاغْفِرْ لِأَبِي إِنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ
verses.translation: And forgive my father. Lo! he is of those who err.

verses.content: وَلَا تُخْزِنِي يَوْمَ يُبْعَثُونَ
verses.translation: And abase me not on the day when they are raised,

verses.content: يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ
verses.translation: The day when wealth and sons avail not (any man)

verses.content: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى اللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
verses.translation: Save him who bringeth unto Allah a whole heart.

verses.content: وَأُزْلِفَتِ الْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.translation: And the Garden will be brought nigh for those who ward off (evil).

verses.content: وَبُرِّزَتِ الْجَحِيمُ لِلْغَاوِينَ
verses.translation: And hell will appear plainly to the erring.

verses.content: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.translation: And it will be said unto them: Where is (all) that ye used to worship

verses.content: مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ هَلْ يَنصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنتَصِرُونَ
verses.translation: Instead of Allah? Can they help you or help themselves?

verses.content: فَكُبْكِبُوا فِيهَا هُمْ وَالْغَاوُونَ
verses.translation: Then will they be hurled therein, they and the seducers

verses.content: وَجُنُودُ إِبْلِيسَ أَجْمَعُونَ
verses.translation: And the hosts of Iblis, together.

verses.content: قَالُوا وَهُمْ فِيهَا يَخْتَصِمُونَ
verses.translation: And they will say, when they are quarrelling therein:

verses.content: تَاللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.translation: By Allah, of a truth we were in error manifest

verses.content: إِذْ نُسَوِّيكُم بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: When we made you equal with the Lord of the Worlds.

verses.content: وَمَا أَضَلَّنَا إِلَّا الْمُجْرِمُونَ
verses.translation: It was but the guilty who misled us.

verses.content: فَمَا لَنَا مِن شَافِعِينَ
verses.translation: Now we have no intercessors

verses.content: وَلَا صَدِيقٍ حَمِيمٍ
verses.translation: Nor any loving friend.

verses.content: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Oh, that we had another turn (on earth), that we might be of the believers!

verses.content: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers!

verses.content: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.translation: And lo, thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

verses.content: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: Noah's folk denied the messengers (of Allah),

verses.content: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: When their brother Noah said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

verses.content: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.translation: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

verses.content: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.translation: So keep your duty to Allah, and obey me.

verses.content: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

verses.content: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.translation: So keep your duty to Allah, and obey me.

verses.content: قَالُوا أَنُؤْمِنُ لَكَ وَاتَّبَعَكَ الْأَرْذَلُونَ
verses.translation: They said: Shall we put faith in thee, when the lowest (of the people) follow thee?

verses.content: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِي بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.translation: He said: And what knowledge have I of what they may have been doing (in the past)?

verses.content: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّي ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ
verses.translation: Lo! their reckoning is my Lord's concern, if ye but knew;

verses.content: وَمَا أَنَا بِطَارِدِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: And I am not (here) to repulse believers.

verses.content: إِنْ أَنَا إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.translation: I am only a plain warner.

verses.content: قَالُوا لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَا نُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمَرْجُومِينَ
verses.translation: They said: If thou cease not, O Noah, thou wilt surely be among those stoned (to death).

verses.content: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِي كَذَّبُونِ
verses.translation: He said: My Lord! Lo! my own folk deny me.

verses.content: فَافْتَحْ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَن مَّعِيَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Therefor judge Thou between us, a (conclusive) judgment, and save me and those believers who are with me.

verses.content: فَأَنجَيْنَاهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُ فِي الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ
verses.translation: And We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.

verses.content: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا بَعْدُ الْبَاقِينَ
verses.translation: Then afterward We drowned the others.

verses.content: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

verses.content: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.translation: And lo, thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

verses.content: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: (The tribe of) A'ad denied the messengers (of Allah).

verses.content: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: When their brother Hud said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

verses.content: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.translation: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

verses.content: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.translation: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.

verses.content: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

verses.content: أَتَبْنُونَ بِكُلِّ رِيعٍ آيَةً تَعْبَثُونَ
verses.translation: Build ye on every high place a monument for vain delight?

verses.content: وَتَتَّخِذُونَ مَصَانِعَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَخْلُدُونَ
verses.translation: And seek ye out strongholds, that haply ye may last for ever?

verses.content: وَإِذَا بَطَشْتُم بَطَشْتُمْ جَبَّارِينَ
verses.translation: And if ye seize by force, seize ye as tyrants?

verses.content: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.translation: Rather keep your duty to Allah, and obey me.

verses.content: وَاتَّقُوا الَّذِي أَمَدَّكُم بِمَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: Keep your duty toward Him Who hath aided you with (the good things) that ye know,

verses.content: أَمَدَّكُم بِأَنْعَامٍ وَبَنِينَ
verses.translation: Hath aided you with cattle and sons.

verses.content: وَجَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
verses.translation: And gardens and watersprings.

verses.content: إِنِّي أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.translation: Lo! I fear for you the retribution of an awful day.

verses.content: قَالُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْنَا أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُن مِّنَ الْوَاعِظِينَ
verses.translation: They said: It is all one to us whether thou preachest or art not of those who preach;

verses.content: إِنْ هَـٰذَا إِلَّا خُلُقُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation: This is but a fable of the men of old,

verses.content: وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
verses.translation: And we shall not be doomed.

verses.content: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: And they denied him; therefor We destroyed them. Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

verses.content: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.translation: And lo! thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

verses.content: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: (The tribe of) Thamud denied the messengers (of Allah)

verses.content: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَالِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: When their brother Salih said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

verses.content: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.translation: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

verses.content: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.translation: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.

verses.content: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

verses.content: أَتُتْرَكُونَ فِي مَا هَاهُنَا آمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Will ye be left secure in that which is here before us,

verses.content: فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
verses.translation: In gardens and watersprings.

verses.content: وَزُرُوعٍ وَنَخْلٍ طَلْعُهَا هَضِيمٌ
verses.translation: And tilled fields and heavy-sheathed palm-trees,

verses.content: وَتَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ الْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا فَارِهِينَ
verses.translation: Though ye hew out dwellings in the mountain, being skilful?

verses.content: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.translation: Therefor keep your duty to Allah and obey me,

verses.content: وَلَا تُطِيعُوا أَمْرَ الْمُسْرِفِينَ
verses.translation: And obey not the command of the prodigal,

verses.content: الَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
verses.translation: Who spread corruption in the earth, and reform not.

verses.content: قَالُوا إِنَّمَا أَنتَ مِنَ الْمُسَحَّرِينَ
verses.translation: They said: Thou art but one of the bewitched;

verses.content: مَا أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِآيَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
verses.translation: Thou art but a mortal like us. So bring some token if thou art of the truthful.

verses.content: قَالَ هَـٰذِهِ نَاقَةٌ لَّهَا شِرْبٌ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
verses.translation: He said: (Behold) this she-camel. She hath the right to drink (at the well), and ye have the right to drink, (each) on an appointed day.

verses.content: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.translation: And touch her not with ill lest there come on you the retribution of an awful day.

verses.content: فَعَقَرُوهَا فَأَصْبَحُوا نَادِمِينَ
verses.translation: But they hamstrung her, and then were penitent.

verses.content: فَأَخَذَهُمُ الْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: So the retribution came on them. Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

verses.content: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.translation: And lo! thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

verses.content: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: The folk of Lot denied the messengers (of Allah),

verses.content: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: When their brother Lot said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

verses.content: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.translation: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

verses.content: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.translation: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.

verses.content: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: And I ask of you no wage therefor; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

verses.content: أَتَأْتُونَ الذُّكْرَانَ مِنَ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: What! Of all creatures do ye come unto the males,

verses.content: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَاجِكُم ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ
verses.translation: And leave the wives your Lord created for you? Nay, but ye are froward folk.

verses.content: قَالُوا لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَا لُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمُخْرَجِينَ
verses.translation: They said: If thou cease not, O Lot, thou wilt soon be of the outcast.

verses.content: قَالَ إِنِّي لِعَمَلِكُم مِّنَ الْقَالِينَ
verses.translation: He said: I am in truth of those who hate your conduct.

verses.content: رَبِّ نَجِّنِي وَأَهْلِي مِمَّا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.translation: My Lord! Save me and my household from what they do.

verses.content: فَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.translation: So We saved him and his household, every one,

verses.content: إِلَّا عَجُوزًا فِي الْغَابِرِينَ
verses.translation: Save an old woman among those who stayed behind.

verses.content: ثُمَّ دَمَّرْنَا الْآخَرِينَ
verses.translation: Then afterward We destroyed the others.

verses.content: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَسَاءَ مَطَرُ الْمُنذَرِينَ
verses.translation: And We rained on them a rain. And dreadful is the rain of those who have been warned.

verses.content: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Lo! herein is indeed a portent, yet most of them are not believers.

verses.content: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.translation: And lo! thy Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

verses.content: كَذَّبَ أَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: The dwellers in the wood (of Midian) denied the messengers (of Allah),

verses.content: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: When Shu'eyb said unto them: Will ye not ward off (evil)?

verses.content: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.translation: Lo! I am a faithful messenger unto you,

verses.content: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.translation: So keep your duty to Allah and obey me.

verses.content: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: And I ask of you no wage for it; my wage is the concern only of the Lord of the Worlds.

verses.content: أَوْفُوا الْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا مِنَ الْمُخْسِرِينَ
verses.translation: Give full measure, and be not of those who give less (than the due).

verses.content: وَزِنُوا بِالْقِسْطَاسِ الْمُسْتَقِيمِ
verses.translation: And weigh with the true balance.

verses.content: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا النَّاسَ أَشْيَاءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا فِي الْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
verses.translation: Wrong not mankind in their goods, and do not evil, making mischief, in the earth.

verses.content: وَاتَّقُوا الَّذِي خَلَقَكُمْ وَالْجِبِلَّةَ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation: And keep your duty unto Him Who created you and the generations of the men of old.

verses.content: قَالُوا إِنَّمَا أَنتَ مِنَ الْمُسَحَّرِينَ
verses.translation: They said: Thou art but one of the bewitched;

verses.content: وَمَا أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
verses.translation: Thou art but a mortal like us, and lo! we deem thee of the liars.

verses.content: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
verses.translation: Then make fragments of the heaven fall upon us, if thou art of the truthful.

verses.content: قَالَ رَبِّي أَعْلَمُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.translation: He said: My Lord is Best Aware of what ye do.

verses.content: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ الظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.translation: But they denied him, so there came on them the retribution of the day of gloom. Lo! it was the retribution of an awful day.

verses.content: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Lo! herein is indeed a portent; yet most of them are not believers.

verses.content: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.translation: And lo! thy Lord! He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.

verses.content: وَإِنَّهُ لَتَنزِيلُ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: And lo! it is a revelation of the Lord of the Worlds,

verses.content: نَزَلَ بِهِ الرُّوحُ الْأَمِينُ
verses.translation: Which the True Spirit hath brought down

verses.content: عَلَىٰ قَلْبِكَ لِتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُنذِرِينَ
verses.translation: Upon thy heart, that thou mayst be (one) of the warners,

verses.content: بِلِسَانٍ عَرَبِيٍّ مُّبِينٍ
verses.translation: In plain Arabic speech.

verses.content: وَإِنَّهُ لَفِي زُبُرِ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation: And lo! it is in the Scriptures of the men of old.

verses.content: أَوَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُمْ آيَةً أَن يَعْلَمَهُ عُلَمَاءُ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
verses.translation: Is it not a token for them that the doctors of the Children of Israel know it?

verses.content: وَلَوْ نَزَّلْنَاهُ عَلَىٰ بَعْضِ الْأَعْجَمِينَ
verses.translation: And if We had revealed it unto one of any other nation than the Arabs,

verses.content: فَقَرَأَهُ عَلَيْهِم مَّا كَانُوا بِهِ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: And he had read it unto them, they would not have believed in it.

verses.content: كَذَٰلِكَ سَلَكْنَاهُ فِي قُلُوبِ الْمُجْرِمِينَ
verses.translation: Thus do We make it traverse the hearts of the guilty.

verses.content: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ
verses.translation: They will not believe in it till they behold the painful doom,

verses.content: فَيَأْتِيَهُم بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.translation: So that it will come upon them suddenly, when they perceive not.

verses.content: فَيَقُولُوا هَلْ نَحْنُ مُنظَرُونَ
verses.translation: Then they will say: Are we to be reprieved?

verses.content: أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
verses.translation: Would they (now) hasten on Our doom?

verses.content: أَفَرَأَيْتَ إِن مَّتَّعْنَاهُمْ سِنِينَ
verses.translation: Hast thou then seen, if We content them for (long) years,

verses.content: ثُمَّ جَاءَهُم مَّا كَانُوا يُوعَدُونَ
verses.translation: And then cometh that which they were promised,

verses.content: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يُمَتَّعُونَ
verses.translation: (How) that wherewith they were contented naught availeth them?

verses.content: وَمَا أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
verses.translation: And We destroyed no township but it had its warners

verses.content: ذِكْرَىٰ وَمَا كُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ
verses.translation: For reminder, for We never were oppressors.

verses.content: وَمَا تَنَزَّلَتْ بِهِ الشَّيَاطِينُ
verses.translation: The devils did not bring it down.

verses.content: وَمَا يَنبَغِي لَهُمْ وَمَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
verses.translation: It is not meet for them, nor is it in their power,

verses.content: إِنَّهُمْ عَنِ السَّمْعِ لَمَعْزُولُونَ
verses.translation: Lo! verily they are banished from the hearing.

verses.content: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا آخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُعَذَّبِينَ
verses.translation: Therefor invoke not with Allah another god, lest thou be one of the doomed.

verses.content: وَأَنذِرْ عَشِيرَتَكَ الْأَقْرَبِينَ
verses.translation: And warn thy tribe of near kindred,

verses.content: وَاخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ اتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: And lower thy wing (in kindness) unto those believers who follow thee.

verses.content: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّي بَرِيءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.translation: And if they (thy kinsfolk) disobey thee, say: Lo! I am innocent of what they do.

verses.content: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى الْعَزِيزِ الرَّحِيمِ
verses.translation: And put thy trust in the Mighty, the Merciful.

verses.content: الَّذِي يَرَاكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
verses.translation: Who seeth thee when thou standest up (to pray)

verses.content: وَتَقَلُّبَكَ فِي السَّاجِدِينَ
verses.translation: And (seeth) thine abasement among those who fall prostrate (in worship).

verses.content: إِنَّهُ هُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
verses.translation: Lo! He, only He, is the Hearer, the Knower.

verses.content: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ الشَّيَاطِينُ
verses.translation: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?

verses.content: تَنَزَّلُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ أَفَّاكٍ أَثِيمٍ
verses.translation: They descend on every sinful, false one.

verses.content: يُلْقُونَ السَّمْعَ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ كَاذِبُونَ
verses.translation: They listen eagerly, but most of them are liars.

verses.content: وَالشُّعَرَاءُ يَتَّبِعُهُمُ الْغَاوُونَ
verses.translation: As for poets, the erring follow them.

verses.content: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِي كُلِّ وَادٍ يَهِيمُونَ
verses.translation: Hast thou not seen how they stray in every valley,

verses.content: وَأَنَّهُمْ يَقُولُونَ مَا لَا يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.translation: And how they say that which they do not?

verses.content: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ وَذَكَرُوا اللَّهَ كَثِيرًا وَانتَصَرُوا مِن بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا أَيَّ مُنقَلَبٍ يَنقَلِبُونَ
verses.translation: Save those who believe and do good works, and remember Allah much, and vindicate themselves after they have been wronged. Those who do wrong will come to know by what a (great) reverse they will be overturned!

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ طس ۚ تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْقُرْآنِ وَكِتَابٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.translation: Ta. Sin. These are revelations of the Qur'an and a Scripture that maketh plain;

verses.content: هُدًى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: A guidance and good tidings for believers

verses.content: الَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ الصَّلَاةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ الزَّكَاةَ وَهُم بِالْآخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ
verses.translation: Who establish worship and pay the poor-due and are sure of the Hereafter.

verses.content: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْآخِرَةِ زَيَّنَّا لَهُمْ أَعْمَالَهُمْ فَهُمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
verses.translation: Lo! as for those who believe not in the Hereafter, We have made their works fairseeming unto them so that they are all astray.

verses.content: أُولَـٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ لَهُمْ سُوءُ الْعَذَابِ وَهُمْ فِي الْآخِرَةِ هُمُ الْأَخْسَرُونَ
verses.translation: Those are they for whom is the worst of punishment, and in the Hereafter they will be the greatest losers.

verses.content: وَإِنَّكَ لَتُلَقَّى الْقُرْآنَ مِن لَّدُنْ حَكِيمٍ عَلِيمٍ
verses.translation: Lo! as for thee (Muhammad), thou verily receivest the Qur'an from the presence of One Wise, Aware.

verses.content: إِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَهْلِهِ إِنِّي آنَسْتُ نَارًا سَآتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ آتِيكُم بِشِهَابٍ قَبَسٍ لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ
verses.translation: (Remember) when Moses said unto his household: Lo! I spy afar off a fire; I will bring you tidings thence, or bring to you a borrowed flame that ye may warm yourselves.

verses.content: فَلَمَّا جَاءَهَا نُودِيَ أَن بُورِكَ مَن فِي النَّارِ وَمَنْ حَوْلَهَا وَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: But when he reached it, he was called, saying: Blessed is Whosoever is in the fire and Whosoever is round about it! And Glorified be Allah, the Lord of the Worlds!

verses.content: يَا مُوسَىٰ إِنَّهُ أَنَا اللَّهُ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
verses.translation: O Moses! Lo! it is I, Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.

verses.content: وَأَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَآهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَانٌّ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِرًا وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ ۚ يَا مُوسَىٰ لَا تَخَفْ إِنِّي لَا يَخَافُ لَدَيَّ الْمُرْسَلُونَ
verses.translation: And throw down thy staff! But when he saw it writhing as it were a demon, he turned to flee headlong; (but it was said unto him): O Moses! Fear not! the emissaries fear not in My presence,

verses.content: إِلَّا مَن ظَلَمَ ثُمَّ بَدَّلَ حُسْنًا بَعْدَ سُوءٍ فَإِنِّي غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
verses.translation: Save him who hath done wrong and afterward hath changed evil for good. And lo! I am Forgiving, Merciful.

verses.content: وَأَدْخِلْ يَدَكَ فِي جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَاءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوءٍ ۖ فِي تِسْعِ آيَاتٍ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَقَوْمِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ
verses.translation: And put thy hand into the bosom of thy robe, it will come forth white but unhurt. (This will be one) among nine tokens unto Pharaoh and his people Lo! they were ever evil-living folk.

verses.content: فَلَمَّا جَاءَتْهُمْ آيَاتُنَا مُبْصِرَةً قَالُوا هَـٰذَا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.translation: But when Our tokens came unto them, plain to see, they said: This is mere magic,

verses.content: وَجَحَدُوا بِهَا وَاسْتَيْقَنَتْهَا أَنفُسُهُمْ ظُلْمًا وَعُلُوًّا ۚ فَانظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُفْسِدِينَ
verses.translation: And they denied them, though their souls acknowledged them, for spite and arrogance. Then see the nature of the consequence for the wrong-doers!

verses.content: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا دَاوُودَ وَسُلَيْمَانَ عِلْمًا ۖ وَقَالَا الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ الَّذِي فَضَّلَنَا عَلَىٰ كَثِيرٍ مِّنْ عِبَادِهِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: And We verily gave knowledge unto David and Solomon, and they said: Praise be to Allah, Who hath preferred us above many of His believing slaves!

verses.content: وَوَرِثَ سُلَيْمَانُ دَاوُودَ ۖ وَقَالَ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ عُلِّمْنَا مَنطِقَ الطَّيْرِ وَأُوتِينَا مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ ۖ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَهُوَ الْفَضْلُ الْمُبِينُ
verses.translation: And Solomon was David's heir. And he said: O mankind! Lo! we have been taught the language of birds, and have been given (abundance) of all things. This surely is evident favour.

verses.content: وَحُشِرَ لِسُلَيْمَانَ جُنُودُهُ مِنَ الْجِنِّ وَالْإِنسِ وَالطَّيْرِ فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ
verses.translation: And there were gathered together unto Solomon his armies of the jinn and humankind, and of the birds, and they were set in battle order;

verses.content: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا أَتَوْا عَلَىٰ وَادِ النَّمْلِ قَالَتْ نَمْلَةٌ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّمْلُ ادْخُلُوا مَسَاكِنَكُمْ لَا يَحْطِمَنَّكُمْ سُلَيْمَانُ وَجُنُودُهُ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.translation: Till, when they reached the Valley of the Ants, an ant exclaimed: O ants! Enter your dwellings lest Solomon and his armies crush you, unperceiving.

verses.content: فَتَبَسَّمَ ضَاحِكًا مِّن قَوْلِهَا وَقَالَ رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِي أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ الَّتِي أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَالِدَيَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَالِحًا تَرْضَاهُ وَأَدْخِلْنِي بِرَحْمَتِكَ فِي عِبَادِكَ الصَّالِحِينَ
verses.translation: And (Solomon) smiled, laughing at her speech, and said: My Lord, arouse me to be thankful for Thy favour wherewith Thou hast favoured me and my parents, and to do good that shall be pleasing unto Thee, and include me in (the number of) Thy righteous slaves.

verses.content: وَتَفَقَّدَ الطَّيْرَ فَقَالَ مَا لِيَ لَا أَرَى الْهُدْهُدَ أَمْ كَانَ مِنَ الْغَائِبِينَ
verses.translation: And he sought among the birds and said: How is it that I see not the hoopoe, or is he among the absent?

verses.content: لَأُعَذِّبَنَّهُ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا أَوْ لَأَذْبَحَنَّهُ أَوْ لَيَأْتِيَنِّي بِسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.translation: I verily will punish him with hard punishment or I verily will slay him, or he verily shall bring me a plain excuse.

verses.content: فَمَكَثَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ فَقَالَ أَحَطتُ بِمَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِ وَجِئْتُكَ مِن سَبَإٍ بِنَبَإٍ يَقِينٍ
verses.translation: But he was not long in coming, and he said: I have found out (a thing) that thou apprehendest not, and I come unto thee from Sheba with sure tidings.

verses.content: إِنِّي وَجَدتُّ امْرَأَةً تَمْلِكُهُمْ وَأُوتِيَتْ مِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ وَلَهَا عَرْشٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.translation: Lo! I found a woman ruling over them, and she hath been given (abundance) of all things, and hers is a mighty throne.

verses.content: وَجَدتُّهَا وَقَوْمَهَا يَسْجُدُونَ لِلشَّمْسِ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ الشَّيْطَانُ أَعْمَالَهُمْ فَصَدَّهُمْ عَنِ السَّبِيلِ فَهُمْ لَا يَهْتَدُونَ
verses.translation: I found her and her people worshipping the sun instead of Allah; and Satan maketh their works fairseeming unto them, and debarreth them from the way (of Truth), so that they go not aright;

verses.content: أَلَّا يَسْجُدُوا لِلَّهِ الَّذِي يُخْرِجُ الْخَبْءَ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُخْفُونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ
verses.translation: So that they worship not Allah, Who bringeth forth the hidden in the heavens and the earth, and knoweth what ye hide and what ye proclaim,

verses.content: اللَّهُ لَا إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ ۩
verses.translation: Allah; there is no Allah save Him, the Lord of the Tremendous Throne.

verses.content: قَالَ سَنَنظُرُ أَصَدَقْتَ أَمْ كُنتَ مِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
verses.translation: (Solomon) said: We shall see whether thou speakest truth or whether thou art of the liars.

verses.content: اذْهَب بِّكِتَابِي هَـٰذَا فَأَلْقِهْ إِلَيْهِمْ ثُمَّ تَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَانظُرْ مَاذَا يَرْجِعُونَ
verses.translation: Go with this my letter and throw it down unto them; then turn away and see what (answer) they return,

verses.content: قَالَتْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ إِنِّي أُلْقِيَ إِلَيَّ كِتَابٌ كَرِيمٌ
verses.translation: (The Queen of Sheba) said (when she received the letter): O chieftains! Lo! there hath been thrown unto me a noble letter.

verses.content: إِنَّهُ مِن سُلَيْمَانَ وَإِنَّهُ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
verses.translation: Lo! it is from Solomon, and lo! it is: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful;

verses.content: أَلَّا تَعْلُوا عَلَيَّ وَأْتُونِي مُسْلِمِينَ
verses.translation: Exalt not yourselves against me, but come unto me as those who surrender.

verses.content: قَالَتْ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ أَفْتُونِي فِي أَمْرِي مَا كُنتُ قَاطِعَةً أَمْرًا حَتَّىٰ تَشْهَدُونِ
verses.translation: She said: O chieftains! Pronounce for me in my case. I decide no case till ye are present with me.

verses.content: قَالُوا نَحْنُ أُولُو قُوَّةٍ وَأُولُو بَأْسٍ شَدِيدٍ وَالْأَمْرُ إِلَيْكِ فَانظُرِي مَاذَا تَأْمُرِينَ
verses.translation: They said: We are lords of might and lords of great prowess, but it is for thee to command; so consider what thou wilt command.

verses.content: قَالَتْ إِنَّ الْمُلُوكَ إِذَا دَخَلُوا قَرْيَةً أَفْسَدُوهَا وَجَعَلُوا أَعِزَّةَ أَهْلِهَا أَذِلَّةً ۖ وَكَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.translation: She said: Lo! kings, when they enter a township, ruin it and make the honour of its people shame. Thus will they do.

verses.content: وَإِنِّي مُرْسِلَةٌ إِلَيْهِم بِهَدِيَّةٍ فَنَاظِرَةٌ بِمَ يَرْجِعُ الْمُرْسَلُونَ
verses.translation: But lo! I am going to send a present unto them, and to see with what (answer) the messengers return.

verses.content: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ سُلَيْمَانَ قَالَ أَتُمِدُّونَنِ بِمَالٍ فَمَا آتَانِيَ اللَّهُ خَيْرٌ مِّمَّا آتَاكُم بَلْ أَنتُم بِهَدِيَّتِكُمْ تَفْرَحُونَ
verses.translation: So when (the envoy) came unto Solomon, (the King) said: What! Would ye help me with wealth? But that which Allah hath given me is better than that which He hath given you. Nay it is ye (and not I) who exult in your gift.

verses.content: ارْجِعْ إِلَيْهِمْ فَلَنَأْتِيَنَّهُم بِجُنُودٍ لَّا قِبَلَ لَهُم بِهَا وَلَنُخْرِجَنَّهُم مِّنْهَا أَذِلَّةً وَهُمْ صَاغِرُونَ
verses.translation: Return unto them. We verily shall come unto them with hosts that they cannot resist, and we shall drive them out from thence with shame, and they will be abased.

verses.content: قَالَ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ أَيُّكُمْ يَأْتِينِي بِعَرْشِهَا قَبْلَ أَن يَأْتُونِي مُسْلِمِينَ
verses.translation: He said: O chiefs! Which of you will bring me her throne before they come unto me, surrendering?

verses.content: قَالَ عِفْرِيتٌ مِّنَ الْجِنِّ أَنَا آتِيكَ بِهِ قَبْلَ أَن تَقُومَ مِن مَّقَامِكَ ۖ وَإِنِّي عَلَيْهِ لَقَوِيٌّ أَمِينٌ
verses.translation: A stalwart of the jinn said: I will bring it thee before thou canst rise from thy place. Lo! I verily am strong and trusty for such work.

verses.content: قَالَ الَّذِي عِندَهُ عِلْمٌ مِّنَ الْكِتَابِ أَنَا آتِيكَ بِهِ قَبْلَ أَن يَرْتَدَّ إِلَيْكَ طَرْفُكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَآهُ مُسْتَقِرًّا عِندَهُ قَالَ هَـٰذَا مِن فَضْلِ رَبِّي لِيَبْلُوَنِي أَأَشْكُرُ أَمْ أَكْفُرُ ۖ وَمَن شَكَرَ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُرُ لِنَفْسِهِ ۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ رَبِّي غَنِيٌّ كَرِيمٌ
verses.translation: One with whom was knowledge of the Scripture said: I will bring it thee before thy gaze returneth unto thee. And when he saw it set in his presence, (Solomon) said: This is of the bounty of my Lord, that He may try me whether I give thanks or am ungrateful. Whosoever giveth thanks he only giveth thanks for (the good of) his own soul; and whosoever is ungrateful (is ungrateful only to his own soul's hurt). For lo! my Lord is Absolute in independence, Bountiful.

verses.content: قَالَ نَكِّرُوا لَهَا عَرْشَهَا نَنظُرْ أَتَهْتَدِي أَمْ تَكُونُ مِنَ الَّذِينَ لَا يَهْتَدُونَ
verses.translation: He said: Disguise her throne for her that we may see whether she will go aright or be of those not rightly guided.

verses.content: فَلَمَّا جَاءَتْ قِيلَ أَهَـٰكَذَا عَرْشُكِ ۖ قَالَتْ كَأَنَّهُ هُوَ ۚ وَأُوتِينَا الْعِلْمَ مِن قَبْلِهَا وَكُنَّا مُسْلِمِينَ
verses.translation: So, when she came, it was said (unto her): Is thy throne like this? She said: (It is) as though it were the very one. And (Solomon said): We were given the knowledge before her and we had surrendered (to Allah).

verses.content: وَصَدَّهَا مَا كَانَت تَّعْبُدُ مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهَا كَانَتْ مِن قَوْمٍ كَافِرِينَ
verses.translation: And (all) that she was wont to worship instead of Allah hindered her, for she came of disbelieving folk.

verses.content: قِيلَ لَهَا ادْخُلِي الصَّرْحَ ۖ فَلَمَّا رَأَتْهُ حَسِبَتْهُ لُجَّةً وَكَشَفَتْ عَن سَاقَيْهَا ۚ قَالَ إِنَّهُ صَرْحٌ مُّمَرَّدٌ مِّن قَوَارِيرَ ۗ قَالَتْ رَبِّ إِنِّي ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِي وَأَسْلَمْتُ مَعَ سُلَيْمَانَ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: It was said unto her: Enter the hall. And when she saw it she deemed it a pool and bared her legs. (Solomon) said: Lo! it is a hall, made smooth, of glass. She said: My Lord! Lo! I have wronged myself, and I surrender with Solomon unto Allah, the Lord of the Worlds.

verses.content: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا إِلَىٰ ثَمُودَ أَخَاهُمْ صَالِحًا أَنِ اعْبُدُوا اللَّهَ فَإِذَا هُمْ فَرِيقَانِ يَخْتَصِمُونَ
verses.translation: And We verily sent unto Thamud their brother Salih, saying: Worship Allah. And lo! they (then became two parties quarrelling.

verses.content: قَالَ يَا قَوْمِ لِمَ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ بِالسَّيِّئَةِ قَبْلَ الْحَسَنَةِ ۖ لَوْلَا تَسْتَغْفِرُونَ اللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
verses.translation: He said: O my people! Why will ye hasten on the evil rather than the good? Why will ye not ask pardon of Allah, that ye may receive mercy.

verses.content: قَالُوا اطَّيَّرْنَا بِكَ وَبِمَن مَّعَكَ ۚ قَالَ طَائِرُكُمْ عِندَ اللَّهِ ۖ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ تُفْتَنُونَ
verses.translation: They said: We augur evil of thee and those with thee. He said: Your evil augury is with Allah. Nay, but ye are folk that are being tested.

verses.content: وَكَانَ فِي الْمَدِينَةِ تِسْعَةُ رَهْطٍ يُفْسِدُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
verses.translation: And there were in the city nine persons who made mischief in the land and reformed not.

verses.content: قَالُوا تَقَاسَمُوا بِاللَّهِ لَنُبَيِّتَنَّهُ وَأَهْلَهُ ثُمَّ لَنَقُولَنَّ لِوَلِيِّهِ مَا شَهِدْنَا مَهْلِكَ أَهْلِهِ وَإِنَّا لَصَادِقُونَ
verses.translation: They said: Swear one to another by Allah that we verily will attack him and his household by night, and afterward we will surely say unto his friend: We witnessed not the destruction of his household. And lo! we are truthtellers.

verses.content: وَمَكَرُوا مَكْرًا وَمَكَرْنَا مَكْرًا وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.translation: So they plotted a plot: and We plotted a plot, while they perceived not.

verses.content: فَانظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ مَكْرِهِمْ أَنَّا دَمَّرْنَاهُمْ وَقَوْمَهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.translation: Then see the nature of the consequence of their plotting, for lo! We destroyed them and their people, every one.

verses.content: فَتِلْكَ بُيُوتُهُمْ خَاوِيَةً بِمَا ظَلَمُوا ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: See, yonder are their dwellings empty and in ruins because they did wrong. Lo! herein is indeed a portent for a people who have knowledge.

verses.content: وَأَنجَيْنَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَكَانُوا يَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: And we saved those who believed and used to ward off (evil).

verses.content: وَلُوطًا إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِ أَتَأْتُونَ الْفَاحِشَةَ وَأَنتُمْ تُبْصِرُونَ
verses.translation: And Lot! when he said unto his folk: Will ye commit abomination knowingly?

verses.content: أَئِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ الرِّجَالَ شَهْوَةً مِّن دُونِ النِّسَاءِ ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ تَجْهَلُونَ
verses.translation: Must ye needs lust after men instead of women? Nay, but ye are folk who act senselessly.

verses.content: فَمَا كَانَ جَوَابَ قَوْمِهِ إِلَّا أَن قَالُوا أَخْرِجُوا آلَ لُوطٍ مِّن قَرْيَتِكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ أُنَاسٌ يَتَطَهَّرُونَ
verses.translation: But the answer of his folk was naught save that they said: Expel the household of Lot from your township, for they (forsooth) are folk who would keep clean!

verses.content: فَأَنجَيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ إِلَّا امْرَأَتَهُ قَدَّرْنَاهَا مِنَ الْغَابِرِينَ
verses.translation: Then We saved him and his household save his wife; We destined her to be of those who stayed behind.

verses.content: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَسَاءَ مَطَرُ الْمُنذَرِينَ
verses.translation: And We rained a rain upon them. Dreadful is the rain of those who have been warned.

verses.content: قُلِ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَسَلَامٌ عَلَىٰ عِبَادِهِ الَّذِينَ اصْطَفَىٰ ۗ آللَّهُ خَيْرٌ أَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.translation: Say (O Muhammad): Praise be to Allah, and peace be on His slaves whom He hath chosen! Is Allah best, or (all) that ye ascribe as partners (unto Him)?

verses.content: أَمَّنْ خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَأَنزَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَأَنبَتْنَا بِهِ حَدَائِقَ ذَاتَ بَهْجَةٍ مَّا كَانَ لَكُمْ أَن تُنبِتُوا شَجَرَهَا ۗ أَإِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ اللَّهِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ يَعْدِلُونَ
verses.translation: Is not He (best) Who created the heavens and the earth, and sendeth down for you water from the sky wherewith We cause to spring forth joyous orchards, whose trees it never hath been yours to cause to grow. Is there any Allah beside Allah? Nay, but they are folk who ascribe equals (unto Him)!

verses.content: أَمَّن جَعَلَ الْأَرْضَ قَرَارًا وَجَعَلَ خِلَالَهَا أَنْهَارًا وَجَعَلَ لَهَا رَوَاسِيَ وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَ الْبَحْرَيْنِ حَاجِزًا ۗ أَإِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ اللَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: Is not He (best) Who made the earth a fixed abode, and placed rivers in the folds thereof, and placed firm hills therein, and hath set a barrier between the two seas? Is there any Allah beside Allah? Nay, but most of them know not!

verses.content: أَمَّن يُجِيبُ الْمُضْطَرَّ إِذَا دَعَاهُ وَيَكْشِفُ السُّوءَ وَيَجْعَلُكُمْ خُلَفَاءَ الْأَرْضِ ۗ أَإِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ اللَّهِ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.translation: Is not He (best) Who answereth the wronged one when he crieth unto Him and removeth the evil, and hath made you viceroys of the earth? Is there any Allah beside Allah? Little do they reflect!

verses.content: أَمَّن يَهْدِيكُمْ فِي ظُلُمَاتِ الْبَرِّ وَالْبَحْرِ وَمَن يُرْسِلُ الرِّيَاحَ بُشْرًا بَيْنَ يَدَيْ رَحْمَتِهِ ۗ أَإِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ اللَّهِ ۚ تَعَالَى اللَّهُ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.translation: Is not He (best) Who guideth you in the darkness of the land and the sea, He Who sendeth the winds as heralds of His mercy? Is there any Allah beside Allah? High Exalted be Allah from all that they ascribe as partner (unto Him)!

verses.content: أَمَّن يَبْدَأُ الْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُ وَمَن يَرْزُقُكُم مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۗ أَإِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ اللَّهِ ۚ قُلْ هَاتُوا بُرْهَانَكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.translation: Is not He (best) Who produceth creation, then reproduceth it, and Who provideth for you from the heaven and the earth? Is there any Allah beside Allah? Say: Bring your proof, if ye are truthful!

verses.content: قُل لَّا يَعْلَمُ مَن فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ الْغَيْبَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ ۚ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ أَيَّانَ يُبْعَثُونَ
verses.translation: Say (O Muhammad): None in the heavens and the earth knoweth the Unseen save Allah; and they know not when they will be raised (again).

verses.content: بَلِ ادَّارَكَ عِلْمُهُمْ فِي الْآخِرَةِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِي شَكٍّ مِّنْهَا ۖ بَلْ هُم مِّنْهَا عَمُونَ
verses.translation: Nay, but doth their knowledge reach to the Hereafter? Nay, for they are in doubt concerning it. Nay, for they cannot see it.

verses.content: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَإِذَا كُنَّا تُرَابًا وَآبَاؤُنَا أَئِنَّا لَمُخْرَجُونَ
verses.translation: Yet those who disbelieve say: When we have become dust like our fathers, shall we verily be brought forth (again)?

verses.content: لَقَدْ وُعِدْنَا هَـٰذَا نَحْنُ وَآبَاؤُنَا مِن قَبْلُ إِنْ هَـٰذَا إِلَّا أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation: We were promised this, forsooth, we and our fathers. (All) this is naught but fables of the men of old.

verses.content: قُلْ سِيرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ فَانظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُجْرِمِينَ
verses.translation: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Travel in the land and see the nature of the sequel for the guilty!

verses.content: وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا تَكُن فِي ضَيْقٍ مِّمَّا يَمْكُرُونَ
verses.translation: And grieve thou not for them, nor be in distress because of what they plot (against thee).

verses.content: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَـٰذَا الْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.translation: And they say: When (will) this promise (be fulfilled), if ye are truthful?

verses.content: قُلْ عَسَىٰ أَن يَكُونَ رَدِفَ لَكُم بَعْضُ الَّذِي تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
verses.translation: Say: It may be that a part of that which ye would hasten on is close behind you.

verses.content: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَذُو فَضْلٍ عَلَى النَّاسِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَشْكُرُونَ
verses.translation: Lo! thy Lord is full of bounty for mankind, but most of them do not give thanks.

verses.content: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُكِنُّ صُدُورُهُمْ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
verses.translation: Lo! thy Lord knoweth surely all that their bosoms hide, and all that they proclaim.

verses.content: وَمَا مِنْ غَائِبَةٍ فِي السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ إِلَّا فِي كِتَابٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.translation: And there is nothing hidden in the heaven or the earth but it is in a clear Record.

verses.content: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا الْقُرْآنَ يَقُصُّ عَلَىٰ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ أَكْثَرَ الَّذِي هُمْ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ
verses.translation: Lo! this Qur'an narrateth unto the Children of Israel most of that concerning which they differ.

verses.content: وَإِنَّهُ لَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةٌ لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: And lo! it is a guidance and a mercy for believers.

verses.content: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقْضِي بَيْنَهُم بِحُكْمِهِ ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْعَلِيمُ
verses.translation: Lo! thy Lord will judge between them of His wisdom, and He is the Mighty, the Wise.

verses.content: فَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى اللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَى الْحَقِّ الْمُبِينِ
verses.translation: Therefor (O Muhammad) put thy trust in Allah, for thou (standest) on the plain Truth.

verses.content: إِنَّكَ لَا تُسْمِعُ الْمَوْتَىٰ وَلَا تُسْمِعُ الصُّمَّ الدُّعَاءَ إِذَا وَلَّوْا مُدْبِرِينَ
verses.translation: Lo! thou canst not make the dead to hear, nor canst thou make the deaf to hear the call when they have turned to flee;

verses.content: وَمَا أَنتَ بِهَادِي الْعُمْيِ عَن ضَلَالَتِهِمْ ۖ إِن تُسْمِعُ إِلَّا مَن يُؤْمِنُ بِآيَاتِنَا فَهُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
verses.translation: Nor canst thou lead the blind out of their error. Thou canst make none to hear, save those who believe Our revelations and who have surrendered.

verses.content: وَإِذَا وَقَعَ الْقَوْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ أَخْرَجْنَا لَهُمْ دَابَّةً مِّنَ الْأَرْضِ تُكَلِّمُهُمْ أَنَّ النَّاسَ كَانُوا بِآيَاتِنَا لَا يُوقِنُونَ
verses.translation: And when the word is fulfilled concerning them, We shall bring forth a beast of the earth to speak unto them because mankind had not faith in Our revelations.

verses.content: وَيَوْمَ نَحْشُرُ مِن كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ فَوْجًا مِّمَّن يُكَذِّبُ بِآيَاتِنَا فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ
verses.translation: And (remind them of) the Day when We shall gather out of every nation a host of those who denied Our revelations, and they will be set in array;

verses.content: حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَاءُوا قَالَ أَكَذَّبْتُم بِآيَاتِي وَلَمْ تُحِيطُوا بِهَا عِلْمًا أَمَّاذَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.translation: Till, when they come (before their Lord), He will say: Did ye deny My revelations when ye could not compass them in knowledge, or what was it that ye did?

verses.content: وَوَقَعَ الْقَوْلُ عَلَيْهِم بِمَا ظَلَمُوا فَهُمْ لَا يَنطِقُونَ
verses.translation: And the Word will be fulfilled concerning them because they have done wrong, and they will not speak.

verses.content: أَلَمْ يَرَوْا أَنَّا جَعَلْنَا اللَّيْلَ لِيَسْكُنُوا فِيهِ وَالنَّهَارَ مُبْصِرًا ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.translation: Have they not seen how We have appointed the night that they may rest therein, and the day sight-giving? Lo! therein verily are portents for a people who believe.

verses.content: وَيَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِي الصُّورِ فَفَزِعَ مَن فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَن فِي الْأَرْضِ إِلَّا مَن شَاءَ اللَّهُ ۚ وَكُلٌّ أَتَوْهُ دَاخِرِينَ
verses.translation: And (remind them of) the Day when the Trumpet will be blown, and all who are in the heavens and the earth will start in fear, save him whom Allah willeth. And all come unto Him, humbled.

verses.content: وَتَرَى الْجِبَالَ تَحْسَبُهَا جَامِدَةً وَهِيَ تَمُرُّ مَرَّ السَّحَابِ ۚ صُنْعَ اللَّهِ الَّذِي أَتْقَنَ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ ۚ إِنَّهُ خَبِيرٌ بِمَا تَفْعَلُونَ
verses.translation: And thou seest the hills thou deemest solid flying with the flight of clouds: the doing of Allah Who perfecteth all things. Lo! He is Informed of what ye do.

verses.content: مَن جَاءَ بِالْحَسَنَةِ فَلَهُ خَيْرٌ مِّنْهَا وَهُم مِّن فَزَعٍ يَوْمَئِذٍ آمِنُونَ
verses.translation: Whoso bringeth a good deed will have better than its worth; and such are safe from fear that Day.

verses.content: وَمَن جَاءَ بِالسَّيِّئَةِ فَكُبَّتْ وُجُوهُهُمْ فِي النَّارِ هَلْ تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.translation: And whoso bringeth an ill-deed, such will be flung down on their faces in the Fire. Are ye rewarded aught save what ye did?

verses.content: إِنَّمَا أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ رَبَّ هَـٰذِهِ الْبَلْدَةِ الَّذِي حَرَّمَهَا وَلَهُ كُلُّ شَيْءٍ ۖ وَأُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
verses.translation: (Say): I (Muhammad) am commanded only to serve the Lord of this land which He hath hallowed, and unto Whom all things belong. And I am commanded to be of those who surrender (unto Him),

verses.content: وَأَنْ أَتْلُوَ الْقُرْآنَ ۖ فَمَنِ اهْتَدَىٰ فَإِنَّمَا يَهْتَدِي لِنَفْسِهِ ۖ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَقُلْ إِنَّمَا أَنَا مِنَ الْمُنذِرِينَ
verses.translation: And to recite the Qur'an. And whoso goeth right, goeth right only for (the good of) his own soul; and as for him who goeth astray - (Unto him) say: Lo! I am only a warner.

verses.content: وَقُلِ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ سَيُرِيكُمْ آيَاتِهِ فَتَعْرِفُونَهَا ۚ وَمَا رَبُّكَ بِغَافِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.translation: And say: Praise be to Allah Who will show you His portents so that ye shall know them. And thy Lord is not unaware of what ye (mortals) do.

verses.content: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَـٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ طسم
verses.translation: Ta. Sin. Mim.

verses.content: تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْكِتَابِ الْمُبِينِ
verses.translation: These are revelations of the Scripture that maketh plain.

verses.content: نَتْلُو عَلَيْكَ مِن نَّبَإِ مُوسَىٰ وَفِرْعَوْنَ بِالْحَقِّ لِقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.translation: We narrate unto thee (somewhat) of the story of Moses and Pharaoh with truth, for folk who believe.

verses.content: إِنَّ فِرْعَوْنَ عَلَا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَجَعَلَ أَهْلَهَا شِيَعًا يَسْتَضْعِفُ طَائِفَةً مِّنْهُمْ يُذَبِّحُ أَبْنَاءَهُمْ وَيَسْتَحْيِي نِسَاءَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ الْمُفْسِدِينَ
verses.translation: Lo! Pharaoh exalted himself in the earth and made its people castes. A tribe among them he oppressed, killing their sons and sparing their women. Lo! he was of those who work corruption.

verses.content: وَنُرِيدُ أَن نَّمُنَّ عَلَى الَّذِينَ اسْتُضْعِفُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَنَجْعَلَهُمْ أَئِمَّةً وَنَجْعَلَهُمُ الْوَارِثِينَ
verses.translation: And We desired to show favour unto those who were oppressed in the earth, and to make them examples and to make them the inheritors,

verses.content: وَنُمَكِّنَ لَهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَنُرِيَ فِرْعَوْنَ وَهَامَانَ وَجُنُودَهُمَا مِنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا يَحْذَرُونَ
verses.translation: And to establish them in the earth, and to show Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts that which they feared from them.

verses.content: وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ أُمِّ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَرْضِعِيهِ ۖ فَإِذَا خِفْتِ عَلَيْهِ فَأَلْقِيهِ فِي الْيَمِّ وَلَا تَخَافِي وَلَا تَحْزَنِي ۖ إِنَّا رَادُّوهُ إِلَيْكِ وَجَاعِلُوهُ مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: And We inspired the mother of Moses, saying: Suckle him and, when thou fearest for him, then cast him into the river and fear not nor grieve. Lo! We shall bring him back unto thee and shall make him (one) of Our messengers.

verses.content: فَالْتَقَطَهُ آلُ فِرْعَوْنَ لِيَكُونَ لَهُمْ عَدُوًّا وَحَزَنًا ۗ إِنَّ فِرْعَوْنَ وَهَامَانَ وَجُنُودَهُمَا كَانُوا خَاطِئِينَ
verses.translation: And the family of Pharaoh took him up, that he might become for them an enemy and a sorrow, Lo! Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts were ever sinning.

verses.content: وَقَالَتِ امْرَأَتُ فِرْعَوْنَ قُرَّتُ عَيْنٍ لِّي وَلَكَ ۖ لَا تَقْتُلُوهُ عَسَىٰ أَن يَنفَعَنَا أَوْ نَتَّخِذَهُ وَلَدًا وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.translation: And the wife of Pharaoh said: (He will be) a consolation for me and for thee. Kill him not. Peradventure he may be of use to us, or we may choose him for a son. And they perceived not.

verses.content: وَأَصْبَحَ فُؤَادُ أُمِّ مُوسَىٰ فَارِغًا ۖ إِن كَادَتْ لَتُبْدِي بِهِ لَوْلَا أَن رَّبَطْنَا عَلَىٰ قَلْبِهَا لِتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: And the heart of the mother of Moses became void, and she would have betrayed him if We had not fortified her heart, that she might be of the believers.

verses.content: وَقَالَتْ لِأُخْتِهِ قُصِّيهِ ۖ فَبَصُرَتْ بِهِ عَن جُنُبٍ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
verses.translation: And she said unto his sister: Trace him. So she observed him from afar, and they perceived not.

verses.content: وَحَرَّمْنَا عَلَيْهِ الْمَرَاضِعَ مِن قَبْلُ فَقَالَتْ هَلْ أَدُلُّكُمْ عَلَىٰ أَهْلِ بَيْتٍ يَكْفُلُونَهُ لَكُمْ وَهُمْ لَهُ نَاصِحُونَ
verses.translation: And We had before forbidden foster-mothers for him, so she said: Shall I show you a household who will rear him for you and take care of him?

verses.content: فَرَدَدْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ أُمِّهِ كَيْ تَقَرَّ عَيْنُهَا وَلَا تَحْزَنَ وَلِتَعْلَمَ أَنَّ وَعْدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: So We restored him to his mother that she might be comforted and not grieve, and that she might know that the promise of Allah is true. But most of them know not.

verses.content: وَلَمَّا بَلَغَ أَشُدَّهُ وَاسْتَوَىٰ آتَيْنَاهُ حُكْمًا وَعِلْمًا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِي الْمُحْسِنِينَ
verses.translation: And when he reached his full strength and was ripe, We gave him wisdom and knowledge. Thus do We reward the good.

verses.content: وَدَخَلَ الْمَدِينَةَ عَلَىٰ حِينِ غَفْلَةٍ مِّنْ أَهْلِهَا فَوَجَدَ فِيهَا رَجُلَيْنِ يَقْتَتِلَانِ هَـٰذَا مِن شِيعَتِهِ وَهَـٰذَا مِنْ عَدُوِّهِ ۖ فَاسْتَغَاثَهُ الَّذِي مِن شِيعَتِهِ عَلَى الَّذِي مِنْ عَدُوِّهِ فَوَكَزَهُ مُوسَىٰ فَقَضَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ۖ قَالَ هَـٰذَا مِنْ عَمَلِ الشَّيْطَانِ ۖ إِنَّهُ عَدُوٌّ مُّضِلٌّ مُّبِينٌ
verses.translation: And he entered the city at a time of carelessness of its folk, and he found therein two men fighting, one of his own caste, and the other of his enemies; and he who was of his caste asked him for help against him who was of his enemies. So Moses struck him with his fist and killed him. He said: This is of the devil's doing. Lo! he is an enemy, a mere misleader.

verses.content: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِي فَاغْفِرْ لِي فَغَفَرَ لَهُ ۚ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.translation: He said: My Lord! Lo! I have wronged my soul, so forgive me. Then He forgave him. Lo! He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

verses.content: قَالَ رَبِّ بِمَا أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيَّ فَلَنْ أَكُونَ ظَهِيرًا لِّلْمُجْرِمِينَ
verses.translation: He said: My Lord! Forasmuch as Thou hast favoured me, I will nevermore be a supporter of the guilty.

verses.content: فَأَصْبَحَ فِي الْمَدِينَةِ خَائِفًا يَتَرَقَّبُ فَإِذَا الَّذِي اسْتَنصَرَهُ بِالْأَمْسِ يَسْتَصْرِخُهُ ۚ قَالَ لَهُ مُوسَىٰ إِنَّكَ لَغَوِيٌّ مُّبِينٌ
verses.translation: And morning found him in the city, fearing, vigilant, when behold! he who had appealed to him the day before cried out to him for help. Moses said unto him: Lo! thou art indeed a mere hothead.

verses.content: فَلَمَّا أَنْ أَرَادَ أَن يَبْطِشَ بِالَّذِي هُوَ عَدُوٌّ لَّهُمَا قَالَ يَا مُوسَىٰ أَتُرِيدُ أَن تَقْتُلَنِي كَمَا قَتَلْتَ نَفْسًا بِالْأَمْسِ ۖ إِن تُرِيدُ إِلَّا أَن تَكُونَ جَبَّارًا فِي الْأَرْضِ وَمَا تُرِيدُ أَن تَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُصْلِحِينَ
verses.translation: And when he would have fallen upon the man who was an enemy unto them both, he said: O Moses! Wouldst thou kill me as thou didst kill a person yesterday. Thou wouldst be nothing but a tyrant in the land, thou wouldst not be of the reformers.

verses.content: وَجَاءَ رَجُلٌ مِّنْ أَقْصَى الْمَدِينَةِ يَسْعَىٰ قَالَ يَا مُوسَىٰ إِنَّ الْمَلَأَ يَأْتَمِرُونَ بِكَ لِيَقْتُلُوكَ فَاخْرُجْ إِنِّي لَكَ مِنَ النَّاصِحِينَ
verses.translation: And a man came from the uttermost part of the city, running. He said: O Moses! Lo! the chiefs take counsel against thee to slay thee; therefor escape. Lo! I am of those who give thee good advice.

verses.content: فَخَرَجَ مِنْهَا خَائِفًا يَتَرَقَّبُ ۖ قَالَ رَبِّ نَجِّنِي مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.translation: So he escaped from thence, fearing, vigilant. He said: My Lord! Deliver me from the wrongdoing folk.

verses.content: وَلَمَّا تَوَجَّهَ تِلْقَاءَ مَدْيَنَ قَالَ عَسَىٰ رَبِّي أَن يَهْدِيَنِي سَوَاءَ السَّبِيلِ
verses.translation: And when he turned his face toward Midian, he said: Peradventure my Lord will guide me in the right road.

verses.content: وَلَمَّا وَرَدَ مَاءَ مَدْيَنَ وَجَدَ عَلَيْهِ أُمَّةً مِّنَ النَّاسِ يَسْقُونَ وَوَجَدَ مِن دُونِهِمُ امْرَأَتَيْنِ تَذُودَانِ ۖ قَالَ مَا خَطْبُكُمَا ۖ قَالَتَا لَا نَسْقِي حَتَّىٰ يُصْدِرَ الرِّعَاءُ ۖ وَأَبُونَا شَيْخٌ كَبِيرٌ
verses.translation: And when he came unto the water of Midian he found there a whole tribe of men, watering. And he found apart from them two women keeping back (their flocks). He said: What aileth you? The two said: We cannot give (our flocks) to drink till the shepherds return from the water; and our father is a very old man.

verses.content: فَسَقَىٰ لَهُمَا ثُمَّ تَوَلَّىٰ إِلَى الظِّلِّ فَقَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي لِمَا أَنزَلْتَ إِلَيَّ مِنْ خَيْرٍ فَقِيرٌ
verses.translation: So he watered (their flock) for them. Then he turned aside into the shade, and said: My Lord! I am needy of whatever good Thou sendest down for me.

verses.content: فَجَاءَتْهُ إِحْدَاهُمَا تَمْشِي عَلَى اسْتِحْيَاءٍ قَالَتْ إِنَّ أَبِي يَدْعُوكَ لِيَجْزِيَكَ أَجْرَ مَا سَقَيْتَ لَنَا ۚ فَلَمَّا جَاءَهُ وَقَصَّ عَلَيْهِ الْقَصَصَ قَالَ لَا تَخَفْ ۖ نَجَوْتَ مِنَ الْقَوْمِ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.translation: Then there came unto him one of the two women, walking shyly. She said: Lo! my father biddeth thee, that he may reward thee with a payment for that thou didst water (the flock) for us. Then, when he came unto him and told him the (whole) story, he said: Fear not! Thou hast escaped from the wrongdoing folk.

verses.content: قَالَتْ إِحْدَاهُمَا يَا أَبَتِ اسْتَأْجِرْهُ ۖ إِنَّ خَيْرَ مَنِ اسْتَأْجَرْتَ الْقَوِيُّ الْأَمِينُ
verses.translation: One of the two women said: O my father! Hire him! For the best (man) that thou canst hire in the strong, the trustworthy.

verses.content: قَالَ إِنِّي أُرِيدُ أَنْ أُنكِحَكَ إِحْدَى ابْنَتَيَّ هَاتَيْنِ عَلَىٰ أَن تَأْجُرَنِي ثَمَانِيَ حِجَجٍ ۖ فَإِنْ أَتْمَمْتَ عَشْرًا فَمِنْ عِندِكَ ۖ وَمَا أُرِيدُ أَنْ أَشُقَّ عَلَيْكَ ۚ سَتَجِدُنِي إِن شَاءَ اللَّهُ مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
verses.translation: He said: Lo! I fain would marry thee to one of these two daughters of mine on condition that thou hirest thyself to me for (the term of) eight pilgrimages. Then if thou completest ten it will be of thine own accord, for I would not make it hard for thee. Allah willing, thou wilt find me of the righteous.

verses.content: قَالَ ذَٰلِكَ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَكَ ۖ أَيَّمَا الْأَجَلَيْنِ قَضَيْتُ فَلَا عُدْوَانَ عَلَيَّ ۖ وَاللَّهُ عَلَىٰ مَا نَقُولُ وَكِيلٌ
verses.translation: He said: That (is settled) between thee and me. Whichever of the two terms I fulfil, there will be no injustice to me, and Allah is Surety over what we say.

verses.content: فَلَمَّا قَضَىٰ مُوسَى الْأَجَلَ وَسَارَ بِأَهْلِهِ آنَسَ مِن جَانِبِ الطُّورِ نَارًا قَالَ لِأَهْلِهِ امْكُثُوا إِنِّي آنَسْتُ نَارًا لَّعَلِّي آتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ جَذْوَةٍ مِّنَ النَّارِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ
verses.translation: Then, when Moses had fulfilled the term, and was travelling with his housefolk, he saw in the distance a fire and said unto his housefolk: Bide ye (here). Lo! I see in the distance a fire; peradventure I shall bring you tidings thence, or a brand from the fire that ye may warm yourselves.

verses.content: فَلَمَّا أَتَاهَا نُودِيَ مِن شَاطِئِ الْوَادِ الْأَيْمَنِ فِي الْبُقْعَةِ الْمُبَارَكَةِ مِنَ الشَّجَرَةِ أَن يَا مُوسَىٰ إِنِّي أَنَا اللَّهُ رَبُّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.translation: And when he reached it, he was called from the right side of the valley in the blessed field, from the tree: O Moses! Lo! I, even I, am Allah, the Lord of the Worlds;

verses.content: وَأَنْ أَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۖ فَلَمَّا رَآهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَانٌّ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِرًا وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ ۚ يَا مُوسَىٰ أَقْبِلْ وَلَا تَخَفْ ۖ إِنَّكَ مِنَ الْآمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Throw down thy staff. And when he saw it writhing as it had been a demon, he turned to flee headlong, (and it was said unto him): O Moses! Draw nigh and fear not. Lo! thou art of those who are secure.

verses.content: اسْلُكْ يَدَكَ فِي جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَاءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوءٍ وَاضْمُمْ إِلَيْكَ جَنَاحَكَ مِنَ الرَّهْبِ ۖ فَذَانِكَ بُرْهَانَانِ مِن رَّبِّكَ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَئِهِ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ
verses.translation: Thrust thy hand into the bosom of thy robe it will come forth white without hurt. And guard thy heart from fear. Then these shall be two proofs from your Lord unto Pharaoh and his chiefs. Lo! they are evil-living folk.

verses.content: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي قَتَلْتُ مِنْهُمْ نَفْسًا فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ
verses.translation: He said: My Lord! Lo! I killed a man among them and I fear that they will kill me.

verses.content: وَأَخِي هَارُونُ هُوَ أَفْصَحُ مِنِّي لِسَانًا فَأَرْسِلْهُ مَعِيَ رِدْءًا يُصَدِّقُنِي ۖ إِنِّي أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
verses.translation: My brother Aaron is more eloquent than me in speech. Therefor send him with me as a helper to confirm me. Lo! I fear that they will give the lie to me.

verses.content: قَالَ سَنَشُدُّ عَضُدَكَ بِأَخِيكَ وَنَجْعَلُ لَكُمَا سُلْطَانًا فَلَا يَصِلُونَ إِلَيْكُمَا ۚ بِآيَاتِنَا أَنتُمَا وَمَنِ اتَّبَعَكُمَا الْغَالِبُونَ
verses.translation: He said: We will strengthen thine arm with thy brother, and We will give unto you both power so that they cannot reach you for Our portents. Ye twain, and those who follow you, will be the winners.

verses.content: فَلَمَّا جَاءَهُم مُّوسَىٰ بِآيَاتِنَا بَيِّنَاتٍ قَالُوا مَا هَـٰذَا إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُّفْتَرًى وَمَا سَمِعْنَا بِهَـٰذَا فِي آبَائِنَا الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.translation: But when Moses came unto them with Our clear tokens, they said: This is naught but invented magic. We never heard of this among our fathers of old.

verses.content: وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ رَبِّي أَعْلَمُ بِمَن جَاءَ بِالْهُدَىٰ مِنْ عِندِهِ وَمَن تَكُونُ لَهُ عَاقِبَةُ الدَّارِ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَا يُفْلِحُ الظَّالِمُونَ
verses.translation: And Moses said: My Lord is Best Aware of him who bringeth guidance from His presence, and whose will be the sequel of the Home (of bliss). Lo! wrong-doers will not be successful.

verses.content: وَقَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ مَا عَلِمْتُ لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيْرِي فَأَوْقِدْ لِي يَا هَامَانُ عَلَى الطِّينِ فَاجْعَل لِّي صَرْحًا لَّعَلِّي أَطَّلِعُ إِلَىٰ إِلَـٰهِ مُوسَىٰ وَإِنِّي لَأَظُنُّهُ مِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
verses.translation: And Pharaoh said: O chiefs! I know not that ye have a god other than me, so kindle for me (a fire), O Haman, to bake the mud; and set up for me a lofty tower in order that I may survey the god of Moses; and lo! I deem him of the liars.

verses.content: وَاسْتَكْبَرَ هُوَ وَجُنُودُهُ فِي الْأَرْضِ بِغَيْرِ الْحَقِّ وَظَنُّوا أَنَّهُمْ إِلَيْنَا لَا يُرْجَعُونَ
verses.translation: And he and his hosts were haughty in the land without right, and deemed that they would never be brought back to Us.

verses.content: فَأَخَذْنَاهُ وَجُنُودَهُ فَنَبَذْنَاهُمْ فِي الْيَمِّ ۖ فَانظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.translation: Therefor We seized him and his hosts, and abandoned them unto the sea. Behold the nature of the consequence for evil-doers!

verses.content: وَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ أَئِمَّةً يَدْعُونَ إِلَى النَّارِ ۖ وَيَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ لَا يُنصَرُونَ
verses.translation: And We made them patterns that invite unto the Fire, and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped.

verses.content: وَأَتْبَعْنَاهُمْ فِي هَـٰذِهِ الدُّنْيَا لَعْنَةً ۖ وَيَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ هُم مِّنَ الْمَقْبُوحِينَ
verses.translation: And We made a curse to follow them in this world, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be among the hateful.

verses.content: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى الْكِتَابَ مِن بَعْدِ مَا أَهْلَكْنَا الْقُرُونَ الْأُولَىٰ بَصَائِرَ لِلنَّاسِ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةً لَّعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.translation: And We verily gave the Scripture unto Moses after We had destroyed the generations of old: clear testimonies for mankind, and a guidance and a mercy, that haply they might reflect.

verses.content: وَمَا كُنتَ بِجَانِبِ الْغَرْبِيِّ إِذْ قَضَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَى الْأَمْرَ وَمَا كُنتَ مِنَ الشَّاهِدِينَ
verses.translation: And thou (Muhammad) wast not on the western side (of the Mount) when We expounded unto Moses the commandment, and thou wast not among those present;

verses.content: وَلَـٰكِنَّا أَنشَأْنَا قُرُونًا فَتَطَاوَلَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْعُمُرُ ۚ وَمَا كُنتَ ثَاوِيًا فِي أَهْلِ مَدْيَنَ تَتْلُو عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتِنَا وَلَـٰكِنَّا كُنَّا مُرْسِلِينَ
verses.translation: But We brought forth generations, and their lives dragged on for them. And thou wast not a dweller in Midian, reciting unto them Our revelations, but We kept sending (messengers to men).

verses.content: وَمَا كُنتَ بِجَانِبِ الطُّورِ إِذْ نَادَيْنَا وَلَـٰكِن رَّحْمَةً مِّن رَّبِّكَ لِتُنذِرَ قَوْمًا مَّا أَتَاهُم مِّن نَّذِيرٍ مِّن قَبْلِكَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.translation: And thou was not beside the Mount when We did call; but (the knowledge of it is) a mercy from thy Lord that thou mayst warn a folk unto whom no warner came before thee, that haply they may give heed.

verses.content: وَلَوْلَا أَن تُصِيبَهُم مُّصِيبَةٌ بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيهِمْ فَيَقُولُوا رَبَّنَا لَوْلَا أَرْسَلْتَ إِلَيْنَا رَسُولًا فَنَتَّبِعَ آيَاتِكَ وَنَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.translation: Otherwise, if disaster should afflict them because of that which their own hands have sent before (them), they might say: Our Lord! Why sentest Thou no messenger unto us, that we might have followed Thy revelations and been of the believers?

verses.content: فَلَمَّا جَاءَهُمُ الْحَقُّ مِنْ عِندِنَا قَالُوا لَوْلَا أُوتِيَ مِثْلَ مَا أُوتِيَ مُوسَىٰ ۚ أَوَلَمْ يَكْفُرُوا بِمَا أُوتِيَ مُوسَىٰ مِن قَبْلُ ۖ قَالُوا سِحْرَانِ تَظَاهَرَا وَقَالُوا إِنَّا بِكُلٍّ كَافِرُونَ
verses.translation: But when there came unto them the Truth from Our presence, they said: Why is he not given the like of what was given unto Moses? Did they not disbelieve in that which was given unto Moses of old? They say: Two magics that support each other; and they say: Lo! in both we are disbelievers.

verses.content: قُلْ فَأْتُوا بِكِتَابٍ مِّنْ عِندِ اللَّهِ هُوَ أَهْدَىٰ مِنْهُمَا أَتَّبِعْهُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.translation: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Then bring a scripture from the presence of Allah that giveth clearer guidance than these two (that) I may follow it, if ye are truthful.

verses.content: فَإِن لَّمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا لَكَ فَاعْلَمْ أَنَّمَا يَتَّبِعُونَ أَهْوَاءَهُمْ ۚ وَمَنْ أَضَلُّ مِمَّنِ اتَّبَعَ هَوَاهُ بِغَيْرِ هُدًى مِّنَ اللَّهِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.translation: And if they answer thee not, then know that what they follow is their lusts. And who goeth farther astray than he who followeth his lust without guidance from Allah. Lo! Allah guideth not wrongdoing folk.

verses.content: وَلَقَدْ وَصَّلْنَا لَهُمُ الْقَوْلَ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.translation: And now verily We have caused the Word to reach them, that haply they may give heed.

verses.content: الَّذِينَ آتَيْنَاهُمُ الْكِتَابَ مِن قَبْلِهِ هُم بِهِ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.translation: Those unto whom We gave the Scripture before it, they believe in it,

verses.content: وَإِذَا يُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ قَالُوا آمَنَّا بِهِ إِنَّهُ الْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّنَا إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبْلِهِ مُسْلِمِينَ
verses.translation: And when it is recited unto them, they say: We believe in it. Lo! it is the Truth from our Lord. Lo! even before it we were of those who surrender (unto Him).

verses.content: أُولَـٰئِكَ يُؤْتَوْنَ أَجْرَهُم مَّرَّتَيْنِ بِمَا صَبَرُوا وَيَدْرَءُونَ بِالْحَسَنَةِ السَّيِّئَةَ وَمِمَّا رَزَقْنَاهُمْ يُنفِقُونَ
verses.translation: These will be given their reward twice over, because they are steadfast and repel evil with good, and spend of that wherewith We have provided them,

verses.content: وَإِذَا سَمِعُوا اللَّغْوَ أَعْرَضُوا عَنْهُ وَقَالُوا لَنَا أَعْمَالُنَا وَلَكُمْ أَعْمَالُكُمْ سَلَامٌ عَلَيْكُمْ لَا نَبْتَغِي الْجَاهِلِينَ
verses.translation: And when they hear vanity they withdraw from it and say: Unto us our works and unto you your works. Peace be unto you! We desire not the ignorant.

verses.content: إِنَّكَ لَا تَهْدِي مَنْ أَحْبَبْتَ وَلَـٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ يَهْدِي مَن يَشَاءُ ۚ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِالْمُهْتَدِينَ
verses.translation: Lo! thou (O Muhammad) guidest not whom thou lovest, but Allah guideth whom He will. And He is Best Aware of those who walk aright.

verses.content: وَقَالُوا إِن نَّتَّبِعِ الْهُدَىٰ مَعَكَ نُتَخَطَّفْ مِنْ أَرْضِنَا ۚ أَوَلَمْ نُمَكِّن لَّهُمْ حَرَمًا آمِنًا يُجْبَىٰ إِلَيْهِ ثَمَرَاتُ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ رِّزْقًا مِّن لَّدُنَّا وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.translation: And they say: If we were to follow the Guidance with thee we should be torn out of our land. Have We not established for them a sure sanctuary, whereunto the produce of all things is brought (in trade), a provision from Our presence? But most of them know not.

verses.content: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ بَطِرَتْ مَعِيشَتَهَا ۖ فَتِلْكَ مَسَاكِنُهُمْ لَمْ تُسْكَن مِّن بَعْدِهِمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا ۖ وَكُنَّا نَحْنُ الْوَارِثِينَ
verses.translation: And how many a community have We destroyed that was thankless for its means of livelihood! And yonder are their dwellings, which have not been inhabited after them save a little. And We, even We, were the inheritors.

verses.content: وَمَا كَانَ رَبُّكَ مُهْلِكَ الْقُرَىٰ حَتَّىٰ يَبْعَثَ فِي أُمِّهَا رَسُولًا يَتْلُو عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتِنَا ۚ وَمَا كُنَّا مُهْلِكِي الْقُرَىٰ إِلَّا وَأَهْلُهَا ظَالِمُونَ
verses.translation: And never did thy Lord destroy the townships, till He had raised up in their mother(-town) a messenger reciting unto them Our revelations. And never did We destroy the townships unless the folk thereof were evil-doers.

verses.content: وَمَا أُوتِيتُم مِّن شَيْءٍ فَمَتَاعُ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا وَزِينَتُهَا ۚ وَمَا عِندَ اللَّهِ خَيْرٌ وَأَبْقَىٰ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.translation: And whatsoever ye have been given is a comfort of the life of the world and an ornament thereof; and that which Allah hath is better and more lasting. Have ye then no sense?

verses.content: أَفَمَن وَعَدْنَاهُ وَعْدًا حَسَنًا فَهُوَ لَاقِيهِ كَمَن مَّتَّعْنَاهُ مَتَاعَ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا ثُمَّ هُوَ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ مِنَ الْمُحْضَرِينَ
verses.translation: Is he whom We have promised a fair promise which he will find (true) like him whom We suffer to enjoy awhile the comfort of the life of the world, then on the Day of Resurrection he will be of those arraigned?

verses.content: وَيَوْمَ يُنَادِيهِمْ فَيَقُولُ أَيْنَ شُرَكَائِيَ الَّذِينَ كُنتُمْ تَزْعُمُونَ
verses.translation: On the day when He will call unto them and say: Where are My partners whom ye imagined?

verses.content: قَالَ الَّذِينَ حَقَّ عَلَيْهِمُ الْقَوْلُ رَبَّنَا هَـٰؤُلَاءِ الَّذِينَ أَغْوَيْنَا أَغْوَيْنَاهُمْ كَمَا غَوَيْنَا ۖ تَبَرَّأْنَا إِلَيْكَ ۖ مَا كَانُوا إِيَّانَا يَعْبُدُونَ
verses.translation: Those concerning whom the Word will have come true will say: Our Lord! These are they whom we led astray. We led them astray even as we ourselves were astray. We declare our innocence before Thee: us they never worshipped.

verses.content: وَقِيلَ ادْعُوا شُرَكَاءَكُمْ فَدَعَوْهُمْ فَلَمْ يَسْتَجِيبُوا لَهُمْ وَرَأَوُا الْعَذَابَ ۚ لَوْ أَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا يَهْتَدُونَ
verses.translation: And it will be said: Cry unto your (so-called) partners (of Allah). And they will cry unto them, and they will give no answer unto them, and they will see the Doom. Ah, if they had but been guided!

verses.content: وَيَوْمَ يُنَادِيهِمْ فَيَقُولُ مَاذَا أَجَبْتُمُ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.translation: And on the Day when He will call unto them and say: What answer gave ye to the messengers?

verses.content: فَعَمِيَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ الْأَنبَاءُ يَوْمَئِذٍ فَهُمْ لَا يَتَسَاءَلُونَ
verses.translation: On that day (all) tidings will be dimmed for them, nor will they ask one of another,

verses.content: فَأَمَّا مَن تَابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَعَسَىٰ أَن يَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُفْلِحِينَ
verses.translation: But as for him who shall repent and believe and do right, he haply may be one of the successful.

verses.content: وَرَبُّكَ يَخْلُقُ مَا يَشَاءُ وَيَخْتَارُ ۗ مَا كَانَ لَهُمُ الْخِيَرَةُ ۚ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَتَعَالَىٰ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
verses.translation: Thy Lord bringeth to pass what He willeth and chooseth. They have never any choice. Glorified be Allah and Exalted above all that they associate (with Him)!

verses.content: وَرَبُّكَ يَعْلَمُ مَا تُكِنُّ صُدُورُهُمْ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
verses.translation: And thy Lord knoweth what their breasts conceal, and what they publish.
